. @realDonaldTrump said tonight, "Healing the hatred, justice not chaos. This is our mission, & we will succeed 100%. We will succeed. Our country always wins."

I pray that justice is swift for George Floyd, hearts are able to forgive, & our communities can live harmoniously.

1267608789232029696.text: From an inspirational man, thank you for these words of peace. https://t.co/x39puD7uVd

1267593142196461568.text: Acts such as these cannot be tolerated. They do not honor George Floyd’s memory or bring justice for his death.

1267593141483421706.text: This organization took away the voice of those who sought to peacefully protest the death of George Floyd. They set fire to St. John’s Church, vandalized national monuments, and wreaked havoc on our communities.

1267593140820742144.text: This weekend the nation saw how peaceful protests were turned into violent riots by Antifa. The President and Attorney General Barr were right to classify Antifa as a domestic terrorist organization.

1267305798750871557.text: I pray this evening, as there is so much unrest, that God will bring peace, forgiveness, and change the hearts of a nation.

1267305798046228480.text: I remember when he led the March on Washington. He did so peacefully, and he changed the world.

1267305797312274433.text: But we must remember the words of Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. - “Darkness cannot drive out darkness; only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate; only love can do that.”

1267305796557328384.text: I understand that Americans are hurting. George Floyd, Ahmaud Arbery, and Breonna Taylor should be alive today.

1267305795827482631.text: The capture and detention of those vandals needs to happen.

1267305794887974912.text: Watching the burning of St. John’s Church has left me speechless. No worthwhile action is achieved, and so Many will have their dreams cauterized. Rebuilding, restoration of what has been done before is so difficult. This will take time and dedication.
